verses.verse: But it came <WH1961> to pass within a while after, in the time <WH3117> of wheat <WH2406> harvest, <WH7105> that Samson <WH8123> visited <WH6485> his wife <WH802> with a kid; <WH1423> <WH5795> and he said, <WH559> I will go <WH935> in to my wife <WH802> into the chamber. <WH2315> But her father <WH1> would not suffer <WH5414> him to go <WH935> in.

And her father <WH1> said, <WH559> I truly <WH559> thought <WH559> that you had utterly hated <WH8130> her; therefore I gave <WH5414> her to your companion: <WH4828> is not her younger <WH6996> sister <WH269> fairer <WH2896> than she? take <WH1961> her, I pray <WH4994> you, instead <WH8478> of her.
And Samson <WH8123> said <WH559> concerning them, Now <WH6471> shall I be more blameless <WH5352> than the Philistines, <WH6430> though <WH3588> I do <WH6213> them a displeasure. <WH7451>

And Samson <WH8123> went <WH3212> and caught <WH3920> three <WH7969> hundred <WH3967> foxes, <WH7776> and took <WH3947> firebrands, <WH3940> and turned <WH6437> tail <WH2180> to tail, <WH2180> and put <WH7760> a firebrand <WH3940> in the middle <WH8432> between <WH996> two <WH8147> tails. <WH2180>

And when he had set the brands <WH3940> on fire, <WH784> he let them go <WH7971> into the standing <WH7054> corn <WH7054> of the Philistines, <WH6430> and burnt <WH1197> up both the shocks, <WH1430> and also <WH5704> the standing <WH7054> corn, <WH7054> with the vineyards <WH3754> and olives. <WH2132>

Then the Philistines <WH6430> said, <WH559> Who <WH4310> has done <WH6213> this? <WH2063> And they answered, <WH559> Samson, <WH8123> the son <WH2860> in law <WH2859> of the Timnite, <WH8554> because <WH3588> he had taken <WH3947> his wife, <WH802> and given <WH5414> her to his companion. <WH4828> And the Philistines <WH6430> came <WH5927> up, and burnt <WH8313> her and her father <WH1> with fire. <WH784>
And Samson <WH8123> said <WH559> to them, Though <WH518> you have done <WH6213> this, <WH2063> yet <WH3588> <WH518> will I be avenged <WH5358> of you, and after <WH310> that I will cease. <WH2308>

And he smote <WH5221> them hip <WH7785> and thigh <WH3409> with a great <WH1419> slaughter: <WH4347> and he went <WH3381> down <WH3381> and dwelled <WH3427> in the top <WH5585> of the rock <WH5553> Etam. <WH5862>
Then the Philistines <WH6430> went <WH5927> up, and pitched <WH2583> in Judah, <WH3063> and spread <WH5203> themselves in Lehi. <WH3896>

And the men <WH376> of Judah <WH3063> said, <WH559> Why <WH4100> are you come <WH5927> up against <WH5921> us? And they answered, <WH559> To bind <WH631> Samson <WH8123> are we come <WH5927> up, to do <WH6213> to him as he has done <WH6213> to us.

Then three <WH7969> thousand <WH505> men <WH376> of Judah <WH3063> went <WH3381> to the top <WH5585> of the rock <WH5553> Etam, <WH5862> and said <WH559> to Samson, <WH8123> Know <WH3045> you not that the Philistines <WH6430> are rulers <WH4910> over us? what <WH4100> is this <WH2063> that you have done <WH6213> to us? And he said <WH559> to them, As they did <WH6213> to me, so <WH3651> have I done <WH6213> to them.

And they said <WH559> to him, We are come <WH3381> down <WH3381> to bind <WH631> you, that we may deliver <WH5414> you into the hand <WH3027> of the Philistines. <WH6430> And Samson <WH8123> said <WH559> to them, Swear <WH7650> to me, that you will not fall <WH6293> on me yourselves. <WH859>

And they spoke <WH559> to him, saying, <WH559> No; <WH3808> but we will bind <WH631> you fast, and deliver <WH5414> you into their hand: <WH3027> but surely we will not kill <WH4191> you. And they bound <WH631> him with two <WH8147> new <WH2319> cords, <WH5688> and brought <WH5927> him up from the rock. <WH5553>

And when he came <WH935> to Lehi, <WH3896> the Philistines <WH6430> shouted <WH7321> against <WH7125> him: and the Spirit <WH7307> of the LORD <WH3068> came <WH6743> <WH935> mightily on him, and the cords <WH5688> that were on his arms <WH2220> became <WH1961> as flax <WH6593> that was burnt <WH1197> with fire, <WH784> and his bands <WH612> loosed <WH4549> from off <WH5921> his hands. <WH3027>

And he found <WH4672> a new <WH2961> jawbone <WH3895> of an ass, <WH2543> and put <WH7971> forth <WH7971> his hand, <WH3027> and took <WH3947> it, and slew <WH5221> a thousand <WH505> men <WH376> therewith.

And Samson <WH8123> said, <WH559> With the jawbone <WH3895> of an ass, <WH2543> heaps <WH2565> on heaps, <WH2565> with the jaw <WH3895> of an ass <WH2543> have I slain <WH5221> a thousand <WH505> men. <WH376>

And it came <WH1961> to pass, when he had made an end <WH3615> of speaking, <WH1696> that he cast <WH7993> away the jawbone <WH3895> out of his hand, <WH3027> and called <WH7121> that place <WH4725> Ramathlehi. <WH7437>

And he was sore <WH3966> thirsty, <WH6770> and called <WH7121> on <WH413> the LORD, <WH3068> and said, <WH559> You have given <WH5414> this <WH2063> great <WH1419> deliverance <WH8668> into the hand <WH3027> of your servant: <WH5650> and now <WH6258> shall I die <WH4191> for thirst, <WH6772> and fall <WH5307> into the hand <WH3027> of the uncircumcised? <WH6189>

But God <WH430> split <WH1234> an hollow <WH4388> place that was in the jaw, <WH3895> and there came <WH3318> water <WH4325> out of there; and when he had drunk, <WH8354> his spirit <WH7307> came <WH7725> again, <WH7725> and he revived: <WH2421> why <WH5921> <WH3651> he called <WH7121> the name <WH8034> thereof Enhakkore, <WH5875> which <WH834> is in Lehi <WH3896> to this <WH2063> day. <WH3117>
And he judged <WH8199> Israel <WH3478> in the days <WH3117> of the Philistines <WH6430> twenty <WH6242> years. <WH8141>
